conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height/thickness, multiple wall faces are visible, interiors read as volumetric spaces, and the view is angled/isometric with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D massing with readable wall thickness and room volumes; clean cutaway. Minor softness/ambiguity at some corners/openings reduces confidence in exact corner geometry.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall apartment organization matches (living left, dining central, kitchen/entry bottom-left, bedrooms/toilets on right). Some proportional deviations and exterior balcony/utility edge conditions are not clearly represented; openings/windows are not reliably verifiable.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (sofas, dining table, beds) and bathroom fixtures visible; kitchen is simplified. Mostly correct room assignment, though some elements are generic blocks and scale/orientation is only moderately precise.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean presentation and lighting; walls/floors are distinguishable. Slight blur/soft rendering reduces readability of door/window edges and fine geometry.

detected_errors.description: Windows/openings are not clearly modeled or are difficult to confirm against the 2D plan; door placement is only partially verifiable.
Minor layout/proportion drift (especially at exterior/balcony/utility boundary conditions) compared to the 2D plan, though core adjacency is preserved.
Soft/blurred render reduces geometric legibility (corners, partitions, and openings).

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with largely faithful room adjacency and furnishing, but with reduced opening/window verifiability and some proportional/exterior-edge deviations.
